intro: Blechnum mochaenum subsp. achalense, commonly known as the Achalénsis Hartman, is a fern native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Blechnaceae family and is characterized by its leathery, lanceolate fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fertile fronds, which are clustered in strobila. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
